item.title: Commercial recycling not being collected, 7th September
item.description:
Bags of commercial recycling -bottles etc from bar or restaurant are often left uncollected building up and attracting more litter and fly tipping. If there is a dispute take it up with the commercial properties but collect the waste please.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping from Victoria Building, 7th September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Pavement is not levelled, 7th September
item.description:
Pavement has a gradient which provides discomfort especially to the people with a disability or have trouble walking. Solution is to provide a level surface which is comfortable to walk on and that does not turn into a land fill site by the morning.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barnabas Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Walm Lane, London

item.title: Usual junk dumped here, 7th September
item.description:
Please can tenancy action be taken against the resident repeatedly dumping items here? It's virtually every week. Please can the envirocrime team investigate? Shouldn't be difficult to establish a likely culprit with some basic investigation. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Timbercroft Lane, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No access / Dead end sign missing, 7th September
item.description:
On Cureton street, on the entry junction of Cureton & Causton Street there needs to be either a 'No entry sign' or 'no access' on the left side to warn vehicles. (photo 1). Vehicles of all types, most notably buses & emergency vehicles, attempt to head down Causton st to access Vauxhall Bridge Road. There is a no-entry sign on the junction if you've come from Regency St but this is not visible from the Cureton & Causton junction. The knock on effect is despite many vehicles forced to do a 3 point turn some choose the illegal route of going the wrong way down Ponsonby place, through the no entry signs. (photo 3). This includes buses and coaches going the wrong way of the narrow Ponsonby place. (Ironically, as I report this another 148 bus is just doing a 3 point turn!)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cureton Street, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 overflowing bags of dead leaves etc left outside my house, 7th September
item.description:
These 2 bags of dead leaves etc should have been collected by GREENWICH COUNCIL'S REFUSE TEAM ! THEY ARE NOT MY RUBBISH !! SOME ONE HAS DUMPED THEM THERE! THIA IS THE SECOND TIME I HAVE REPORTED THIS PLEASE COME AND TAKE THEM AWAY. ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Hyde Vale, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
